title: Research
text:
I am interested in microbial interactions, with a particular focus on inter-species interactions and co-evolution. My research plans focus on developing wet laboratory and computational methods to support co-evolution studies. Ultimately, I aim to use co-evolution to explore new avenues for antibiotic biosynthesis and development antimicrobial resistance.
I am always interested in developing new collaborations and applications for my work, contact me if you would like to discuss potential projects.

title: A to Z of Microbes
text:
Welcome to the A to Z of Microbes. Every two weeks I will write about a microorganism, either fungi, archae or bacteria, starting from A and finishing with Z. Each post will be accompanied by a Q&A with an early career researcher working on the organism.
I hope you enjoy.

title: Everything Else
text:
Here is where I share everything else. I am a keen knitter, enjoy running and have a cocker spaniel named Tarka.
If you want to find out more then feel free to hang out here and have a read.

Stay a while
I began my research career working on antibiotic productivity, using genomics and metabolomics. My past research positions have covered many research areas, from Industrial Biotechnology to Environmental Engineering and most recently Molecular Epidemiology. These roles have allowed me to apply my skills in molecular microbiology and computational biology.
This is my personal website to highlight my research, personal interests and my outreach project: The A to Z of Microbes.
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential projects.
